*[Bug 18924] New: Short-hand lambda ('\(') probably shouldn't parse with an interceding comment*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18924>

            Bug ID: 18924
           Summary: Short-hand lambda ('\(') probably shouldn't parse with
                    an interceding comment
           Product: R
           Version: R-devel (trunk)
          Hardware: All
                OS: All
            Status: UNCONFIRMED
          Severity: trivial
          Priority: P5
         Component: Low-level
          Assignee: <mailto:R-core@R-project.org|R-core@R-project.org>
          Reporter: <mailto:michaelchirico4@gmail.com|michaelchirico4@gmail.com>

This parses -- should it?

```r
foo <- \ #comment
  (x) x
```

Not encountered in any real example [1], so could be closed if it's non-trivial
to fix.

<https://github.com/r-lib/lintr/pull/2901/files#diff-0a025b1d2cc764fc1b4f0a985930624a514d40de115f43ca3f1429020ba9ded0R73-R75>
